other_tests.findings: Preserved left ventricular function but a dilated right ventricle with slightly reduced systolic function.

Confirmed pulmonary arterial hypertension with a mean pulmonary arterial pressure of 51 mm Hg, mean wedge pressure of 9 mm Hg, and pulmonary vascular resistance of 988 dyne·s·cm⁻⁵. Revealed an isolated severe left main coronary artery stenosis.
Showed a massive aneurysm of the pulmonary arterial vasculature involving the pulmonary trunk (93 mm) and external compression of the left main coronary artery.
Identified two intimal flaps as a sign of chronic pulmonary trunk dissection.
Did not identify any underlying genetic disorder, especially any connective tissue disease.
Showed evidence of atherosclerosis with intimal fibrosis, but no other tissue alterations.
